title:
Welcome to 
 Offline Support
description:
Congratulations on joining the Month Offline challenge! Flipping off is a big step, and it might not be easy at first. We've put together some technical tips and best practices to ease your transition to the flip side. You'll eventually figure out what works best for you,  but we’re here to help you get started.


Click "Next" to begin.

title:
Your Mobile Phone,
Now a Stationary Phone
description: Stash your smartphone in the Phone Zone at the bottom of your Month Offline kit. Out of sight, out of mind. It’ll be there for those rare moments when you need it. Fear not: you’ll be able forward texts and calls to your dumbphone while your touchscreen is safely in the Phone Zone. Just make sure to keep it plugged in using the charging hole at the bottom of your kit.

title: Download the Dumb Down App
description:
We built an app for iOS to allow your smartphone and dumbphone to sync seamlessly. Use Dumb Down to forward calls and texts from your smart to dumb phone, and even send replies from your dumbphone that will appear as though they are coming from your smartphone number.

 You can toggle text forwarding off and on as needed depending on what kind of Offline experience you are yearning for. Just for iPhone now, but the Android version is on the way!

title: Set up Call Forwarding
description:
If you are on Android and can't use the Dumb Down app, you can still set up call forwarding directly from your smartphone to your dumbphone. This way, when people call your regular number, it will ring on your dumbphone.

If you are on AT&T or T-Mobile, dial '**21*' followed by your dumbphone number and then '#' e.g. **21*4041234567#.
To turn off, dial ##21#. 

 For Verizon, dial *72 followed by your dumbphone number (e.g. *724041234567) to turn on and *73 to turn off.

title:
Set up SMS Forwarding 
 to your Computer
description: During your Month Offline, text messaging is more like a daily trip to the mailbox than an always-on feed. You’ll actually be offline while you’re out and about, and your mobile phone will be true to its name: a device for making and taking calls while you’re on the move. If you have Apple devices, you’ll be using iMessage on your Computer. If you have Windows PC or Android device, you’ll be using Google Messages or Link to Windows.

title: Use the Internet Chair
description:
When getting Dumb, bad digital habits can sometimes creep back in and just shift over to the computer. Try keeping your computer at one location in your home, preferably somewhere where you need to sit up-right, and only access the internet while you are at that spot.

You'll find an 'internet' sticker with your phone upon recieiving your challenge materials.

title: 2 Factor Authentication
description:
Where you can, for websites or applications that require 2fa, change your method from an Authenicator Mobile App to a Text Message Code. With SMS Forwarding set up, you'll recieve this on your computer. 

 You also can purchase a Yubikey hardware token which you can set up to use as a private key instead.

title: Setting Expectations
description:
Tell people that you are doing the Month Offline Challenge. Communicate how you'd like to be reached. When will you be at your desktop and checking text messages and emails? Tell the people in your life that the best way to reach you is to call your normal number, which will forward to your Dumbphone. Check in with friends and family and let them know that you might be calling them more instead of texting.

t9 is a beast (but also so so fun).

title: Experiment and Enjoy
description:
Don’t be a purist, and be patient with yourself if you slip up. The goal is to be more mindful about your relationship with your devices and strike the right balance between convenience and friction. Try to push yourself to find creative workarounds this month.There is no one right way to be. 

Explore. Get Lost. Make a friend. 

Ring Ring. Adventure Awaits!
